meanings.definition: To eliminate or prevent segregation in (a place or institution)
meanings.sent1: The school board voted to desegregate the classrooms, so all students could learn together.
meanings.sent2: The city worked hard to desegregate the public parks, allowing everyone to enjoy them equally.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was much more fun after they decided to desegregate the seating arrangements.
meanings.sent4: Her efforts to desegregate the community brought people together like never before.
meanings.sent5: The decision to desegregate the buses made transportation fair for all passengers.

meanings.definition: To integrate racially segregated groups or facilities
meanings.sent1: The organization's goal is to desegregate neighborhoods and promote diversity.
meanings.sent2: Efforts to desegregate the sports teams have led to stronger unity among players.
meanings.sent3: The potluck was a great opportunity to desegregate the different food traditions.
meanings.sent4: Her speech on unity aimed to desegregate hearts and minds across the nation.
meanings.sent5: The project aims to desegregate the workplace and create a more inclusive environment.
